stems.BSC: (to be) a solid, something solid; to be/make solid, solidify
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being solid
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical process(es) by which one solidifies something (e.g., freezing, dehydration, oxidation, etc.)
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which is solid

stems: (to be) a liquid, something liquid; to be/make liquid, to liquefy
(to be) a gas, something gaseous; to be/make into a gas, to render into a gaseous state

refers: LESS TYPICAL PHYSICAL STATES OF MATTER

stems.BSC: (to be) something in a semi-solid, semi-liquid, viscous, state (e.g., mud, something gelatinous, slime, etc.)
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being semi-solid
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical process(es) by which one makes something semi-solid
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which is semi-solid

stems: (to be) a plasma; to be/make into a plasma
(to be) a Bose-Einstein condensate; to be/make into a Bose-Einstein condensate

stems.BSC: (to be) a fundamental manifestation (e.g., chunk, drop, flume, bit, piece, etc.) of a material substance + substance itself
stems.CTE: (to be) the material substance being manifested
stems.CSV: (to be) the form of a fundamental manifestation of a material substance (i.e., chunk, drop, flume, bit, piece, etc.)
stems.OBJ: (to be) the party/entity in contact with, confronted with, observing, handling, etc. a material substance

stems: (to be) an instance/act of utilizing, manipulating, handling, or working with a substance; to handle, manipulate, work with, utilizing a substance
(to be) the source of a material substance / compound

refers: QUALITY, ATTRIBUTE OR PROPERTY OF MATTER

stems.BSC: (to be) a degree of a particular quality (= intrinsic/inherent behavioral property) of matter
stems.CTE: (to be) the intrinsic nature/essence of a particular quality of matter (i.e., the existence of the quality within or as part of an entity regardless of its physical manifestation)
stems.CSV: (to be) the physical manifestation of a particular quality of matter; to manifest a particular quality of matter
stems.OBJ: (to be) the object/entity having the particular quality of matter

stems: (to be) a decrease in the degree of a particular quality/attribute/property of matter
(to be) an increase in the degree of a particular quality/attribute/property of matter
notes: (use with the SUF, EXD, FLC, PTW, ITY, etc. affixes)
[i.e., the amount of elapsed time over which an event or state occurs]
(i.e., parallel in comparison to an external linear or planar reference standard)

refers: PLUME / CLOUD OF GAS / SMOKE / STEAM / GASEOUS PHENOMENON

stems.BSC: (to be) a plume/cloud of smoke from an act/process of combustion (e.g., smoke from a fireplace, from an explosion, from a volcano, from a forest fire, etc.)
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of smokiness; for the air to be filled with smoke
stems.CSV: (to be) an act/process of combustion which gives rise to a plume of smoke; for there to be smoke due to an act/process of combustion
stems.OBJ: (to be) the plume of smoke itself

stems: (to be) a plume/cloud of steam/water vapor [NOTE: for a cloud in the sky, see the root -**FTH**-]
(to be) a plume/cloud of gas other than steam or smoke from combustion (e.g., a gas leak)

refers: CONSISTENCY / MALLEABILITY / FLEXIBILITY / PLASTICITY / RHEOLOGICAL PHENOMENON

stems.BSC: (to be) a particular degree of malleability, flexibility, plasticity; to have a certain degree of malleability, flexibility, plasticity
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of malleability, flexibility, plasticity; to be malleable, flexible
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of determining the degree of malleability, flexibility, plasticity of something; to determine the degree of malleability, flexibility, plasticity of something
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which has a particular consistency in terms of malleability, flexibility, plasticity

stems: (to be) a particular degree of squeezability, compressibility
(to be) a particular degree of elasticity

stems.BSC: (to be) a particular degree of springiness; to have/manifest a particular degree of springiness
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of springiness; to be springy
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of determining the degree of springiness
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which has a particular degree of springiness

stems: (to be) a particular degree of buoyancy; to have/display a particular degree of buoyancy
(to be) a particular degree of recoil; to have/display a particular degree of recoil

stems.BSC: (to be) a particular degree of fragility; to have/manifest a particular degree of flimsiness
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of fragility; to be fragile
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of determining the degree of fragility; to determine the degree of fragility of something
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which has a particular degree of fragility

stems: (to be) a particular degree of brittleness
(to be) a particular degree of crumbliness

stems.BSC: (to be) a particular degree of limpness/flaccidity; to have/manifest a particular degree of limpness/flaccidity
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of limpness/flaccidity; to be limp/flaccid
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of determining the degree of limpness/flaccidity; to determine the degree of limpness/flaccidity of something
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which has a particular degree of limpness/flaccidity

stems: (to be) a particular degree of jiggliness
(to be) a particular degree of flabbiness

stems.BSC: (to be) a particular degree of pliancy/ductility/suppleness; to have/manifest a particular degree of pliancy/ductility/suppleness
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of pliancy/ductility/suppleness; to be pliant/ductile/supple
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of determining the degree of limpness/flaccidity; to determine the degree of pliancy/ductility/suppleness of something
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which has a particular degree of pliancy/ductility/suppleness

stems: (to be) a particular degree of deformability or “dentability” (i.e., how easily deformed or dented a material is)
(to be) a particular degree of spreadability

stems.BSC: (to be) a particular degree of flimsiness; to have/manifest a particular degree of flimsiness
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of flimsiness; to be flimsy
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of determining the degree of flimsiness; to determine the degree of flimsiness of something
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which has a particular degree of flimsiness

stems: (to be) a particular degree of cohesiveness (tendency to not break apart)
(to be) a particular degree of structural integrity/stability

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of being bright/luminous; to be bright/luminous (i.e., either emanating or reflecting a relatively large amount of light from either external or internal illumination)
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being bright/luminous
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act of brightening/illuminating; to brighten, to illuminate
stems.OBJ: (to be) something that is bright, highly reflective, or lit up, (to be) a (source of) light

stems: (to be) a state of being bright/luminous due to internal illumination (i.e., entity is, or carries within, its own source of illumination)
(to be) a state/act of being bright/luminous due to high surface reflectivity

stems.BSC: (to be) a state of being dim or act of dimming; to be/make dim, to dim (i.e., difficult to see, not very visible due to insufficient external or internal illumination)
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being dim
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act of dimming; do something to make an entity dim
stems.OBJ: (to be) something that is dim

stems: (to be) a state of being pale/blanched/pallid/wan; to be/make pale/pallid/wan/blanched
(to be) a state/act of being/placing in the shade or in shadow; to be/place in the shade or in shadow

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of being/making something dull/lackluster in appearance; be/make dull/lackluster in appearance (i.e., decreased reflectivity)
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being dull/lackluster
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act of making dull/lackluster; do something to make an entity dull/lackluster
stems.OBJ: (to be) something that is dull/lackluster

stems: (to be) a state/act of being something faded; to be faded, to fade (i.e., loss of former degree of brightness/visibility due to age, wear, decay)
(to be) a state/act of being something murky/gloomy; be/make murky/gloomy

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of burning with/by fire; to burn by fire
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being burned, being on fire; to be on fire, to be in flames
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of igniting or combustion; to ignite, to combust, to catch fire
stems.OBJ: (to be) a flame [Derivatives: a fire, a blaze, a conflagration, etc.]

stems: (to be) a state of a substance being/becoming heated by an external source of heat; to heat (up), to warm (up)
(to be) a state of melting/liquefaction; to melt, to liquefy via heat

refers: “COLDNESS / COOLING / FREEZING” Derivations: air conditioner, refrigerator

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of being/becoming cold/frigid; to be(come) cold/frigid
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of coldness, a state of being cold
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of chilling; to chill something
stems.OBJ: (to be) a tangible sign/indicator of coldness (e.g., ice, snow, frost, etc.)

stems: (to be) a state of a substance being/becoming cool/cold by an external source of cold; to cool (down), to get cold
(to be) a state of being frozen; to freeze

refers: DISCARD AS RUBBISH / TRASH / GARBAGE / DETRITUS / REFUSE / RUBBLE / DEBRIS

stems.BSC: (to be) an act/process of discarding something as rubbish/trash/garbage/refuse
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being/constituting rubbish/trash/garbage/refuse
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act of discarding something as rubbish/trash/garbage/refuse
stems.OBJ: (to be) an object/item/entity/amount of material discarded as rubbish/trash/garbage/ refuse

stems: (to be) an act/process of discarding something as junk/flotsam/ dross/offal/leavings/scraps/remnants (i.e., worthless leftover material from some productive or consumptive process)
(to be) an act/process whose material result/outcome constitutes rubble/debris/detritus/remains (i.e., disintegrated remnant material)

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of being/placing sideways; to (be) position(ed)/orient(ed) sideways (relative to an observer)
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being in a sideways position
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of physically orienting/placing something sideways (relative to an observer)
stems.OBJ: (to be) the entity which is positioned sideways

stems: (to be) a state/act of being/placing upside-down; (be) position(ed)/orient(ed) upside-down

(to be) a (to be) a state/act of being/placing backwards [i.e., only in sense of facing the opposite direction than expected]; (be) position(ed)/orient(ed) backward [i.e., facing the opposite direction]

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of being a mirror-image; to invert in a mirror-image fashion
stems.CTE: (to be) the state of being a mirror-image
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of physically causing/making a mirror-image
stems.OBJ: (to be) the entity which is mirror-imaged

stems: (to be) a state/act of being/placing; to (be) position(ed)/orient(ed) inside-out
(to be) a state/act of being a mirror-image both laterally and vertically (i.e., mirror-image plus upside-down)

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of forking into two, bifurcation; to bifurcate
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of being bifurcate(d)
stems.CSV: (to be) a physical act/process of bifurcation
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which forks into two, that which is forked in two

stems: (to be) a state of forking into three or more branches/paths, etc.
(to be) a state of continuous (bi-)furcation/branching, so that the number of branches/paths multiplies over time or space (e.g., tree branches, a philogenic taxonomic chart, etc.)

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of being in balance / act of balancing; to balance / to be/make balanced (i.e., so that a state/entity/construction is stable)
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of balance
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of balancing; adjust the position/state of something so that it is in balance
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which is balanced or in balance

stems: (to be) a state/act of equilibrium
(to be) a state/act of a set of entities being in proper proportion to one another; to be in proper proportion to one other (i.e., in terms of optimal functionality or well-being)

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of being symmetrical, or having/displaying symmetry; to be/make symmetrical, to have/display symmetry
stems.CTE: (to be) a state of symmetry
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of making something symmetrical; to make symmetrical
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which is symmetrical

stems: (to be) a state/act of being in parity; to be/place in parity
(to be) a state/act of homeostasis; to be/make homeostatic, have/display homeostasis

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of curling; to curl, to (be)form(ed) into a curl (both the shape/form and the entity so shaped/formed)
stems.CTE: (to be) in (the form of) a curl, be curled, be curly
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of forming into a curl; to (form into a) curl
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which is curled

stems: (to be) a state/act of looping, being in a loop; to (be) form(ed) into a loop
(to be) a state/act of coiling, being coiled; to coil, be formed into a coil

stems.BSC: (to be) a state/act of twisting; to twist, be twisted, form into a twist [i.e., curled in more than one planar dimension]
stems.CTE: (to be) in (the form of) a twist; to be twisted
stems.CSV: (to be) an act of twisting; to (form into a) twist
stems.OBJ: (to be) that which is twisted or in a twist

stems: (to be) an act/state of being knotted, tied in a knot; to knot, tie in a knot
(to be) a state/act of tangling; to tangle, be tangled, form into a tangle
